adjectives.description: summerproof (comparative more summerproof, superlative most summerproof)

entries.meaning: Resistant to the hot, dry weather conditions of summer.
examples: Too much fun in the sun (and salt water and chlorinated pools) can wreak havoc with even the healthiest hair, leaving it dry and dull. Here are eight steps to summerproof hair:  […]

verbs.description: summerproof (third-person singular simple present summerproofs, present participle summerproofing, simple past and past participle summerproofed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make resistant to the hot, dry weather conditions of summer.
